snippet.title: Vic man stole $1200 handbag for girlfriend
snippet.content: A young Melbourne man stole a $1200 handbag from Myer because he wanted to make his girlfriend happy on her birthday, a court has heard. Daniel Porter, 20, has been fined $250 for stealing the pricey designer handbag from the CBD store on Friday evening. He was caught and arrested, admitting he nabbed the bag because he only earned $50 a week working part-time at a clothing store and couldn't afford it. "From what I've heard it was to please your girlfriend," Melbourne Magistrate Alan Spillane said as Porter faced court on Saturday. "This is a very significant theft. It's not just a simple shoplifting. "But you're a young man and have time to turn your life around." Porter was fined for the theft and released from custody. "Thank you very much. Have a good day, your honour," the young man said as he left court. Originally published as
